other_tests.findings: Bone marrow contained fat necrosis, reactive-appearing spindle cells, and granulation tissue, findings consistent with reactive changes.
Initial T scores of −4.4 in the spine, −2.7 in the hip, and −3.1 in the neck of the femur indicating osteoporosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Ten months after bisphosphonate treatment, repeat dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry showed no significant change in spine, femoral neck, or total hip but a 4.3% improvement in the trochanter.

other_tests.findings: Initial sequencing showed negative results for mutations associated with osteogenesis imperfecta but detected mutations in COL1A1 and COL1A2.
